TITLE: Building and verifying the documentation
DESCRIPTION: These commands build the documentation locally using Maven and then open the generated HTML preview in a web browser.  The `mvn clean install -Dfull` command compiles the documentation, and the google-chrome command (replace with desired browser) opens the index.html file of generated documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ cd ~/incubator-kie-docs
$ mvn clean install -Dfull
[Build output]
$ google-chrome doc-content/kogito-docs/target/generated-docs/html_single/index.html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning a forked repository
DESCRIPTION: This command clones a forked repository from GitHub to a local directory, enabling users to work on the documentation locally.  The PATH_TO_REPO_DIRECTORY should be replaced with the actual directory path on the user's system, and USER_NAME with the user's GitHub username.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ cd PATH_TO_REPO_DIRECTORY
$ git clone git@github.com:USER_NAME/incubator-kie-docs.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing and pushing to a fork
DESCRIPTION: These commands commit the changes made to the working branch and push them to the user's fork in GitHub. Ensure all modified files are staged and committed using git add --all. The commit message should be descriptive. For the first push, use git push -u origin branch-name; subsequent pushes can use git push.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ cd ~/incubator-kie-docs #Recommended to move back "up" in the directory to ensure all modified files are staged and committed.
$ git add --all
$ git commit -m "kie-issues-444: Update section on DMN data types."
$ git push -u origin kie-issues-444 #For first-time push, subsequently just `git push`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding and verifying the upstream remote
DESCRIPTION: These commands add and verify the upstream remote repository. The `upstream` remote allows you to fetch updates from the original repository. The `git remote -v` command verifies that the upstream remote has been added correctly, showing both fetch and push URLs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ git remote add upstream https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs.git
$ git remote -v
origin git@github.com:jsmith/incubator-kie-docs.git (fetch)
origin git@github.com:jsmith/incbuator-kie-docs.git (push)
upstream https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs.git (fetch)
upstream https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs.git (push)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a work branch
DESCRIPTION: These commands check out the `main` branch from the upstream remote and create a new working branch based on it. The working branch is used to make changes to the documentation.  The Branch-name should be replaced with a descriptive name for the branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ git checkout --track upstream/main
$ git checkout -b Branch-name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Git using yum
DESCRIPTION: This command installs Git on Fedora, CentOS, or RHEL systems using the yum package manager.  It allows users to manage versions, clone repositories, and contribute to documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# yum install git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Asciidoctor using yum
DESCRIPTION: This command installs Asciidoctor on Fedora, CentOS, or RHEL systems using the yum package manager. Asciidoctor is necessary to publish content written in AsciiDoc format, which is used in the Kogito documentation files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# yum install asciidoctor
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Maven using yum
DESCRIPTION: This command installs Apache Maven on Fedora, CentOS, or RHEL systems using the yum package manager. Maven is used for building the KIE Apache (incubating) Kogito documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/incubator-kie-docs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# yum install maven
```
